Posts.Content: Hi Clarkie, I had my lump for 3 weeks didn’t tel my hubby or family. We were having family celebration’s over that 3 weeks my grandaughter’s engagement, our 50th anniversary etc, I wasn’t really worried at the time because I just thought it was another cyst, finally told my husband, went to the doctor’s and was referred to the breast clinic, I was told the same day it was Cancer a grade 2 Her negative, have had Lumpectomy and node clearance. I am twelve month’s down the line now due to have my first mammogram on Friday. Good luck I am sure your’s will be ok.x sending hugs.x
Posts.Title: New to the club

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed with Lobular cancer ER. Grade 2. 1 node affected so had Lumpectomy and full node clearance, didn’t have chemo because my score was low, had 15 Radiotheraphy, just been signed off. I am ok now just trying to get on with my life, you will be worried but try not to be just keep busy . Good Luck.
Posts.Title: Waiting for MRI invasive lobular cancer ER+

Posts.Content: Is there anybody on here from Formby, Southport, or Liverpool.
Posts.Title: meet up

Posts.Content: Hi Peterwake.  I also take Letrozol the Teva brand haven’t had many side effects my legs ache first thing in the morning and I get very tired, I take my tablet at night at about 7PM, can you not get the Teva brand I think it’s £49 for 28 tablets. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Letrozole/Femara

Posts.Content: Hi were you treated at Aintree Hostpital, suppose we could arrange a meet up hopefully in Liverpool at some time, when we get more ladies from the North West.
Posts.Title: meet up

Posts.Content: Hi Sunnycat. well done you for getting through all of this horrendous ordeal I didn’t have Chemo had Lumpectomy and lympth node clearence some of the women on here are about to have chemo this forum is so good at explaining thing about the treatment they are going to have. I wish you good luck treat yourself when you are feeling stronger you deserve it.x
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Mariana just to say I am thinking about you this site is wonderful so don’t feel alone we are here to help anytime, I live a long way from you but if I lived near I would come to see you. sending Love and hugs.
Posts.Title: living alone with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi, yes I have had it due for my third one in November, it’s ok no problems just felt achy after the first one but no side effects now.
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Zoledronic Acid Infusion???

Posts.Content: Hi Shellian, I see Sal has put a lovely message on for you, she is a great lady and deserves a medal she has helped so many people on here, I wish I could write like her, you are going through a bad time, we are here for you, I was diagnosed in April and my daughter in 2015 she is due her second mammogram on 7th Dec we are all worried about her but we have been quite positive really, so I am sending you a hug as well, take care of yourself.xx
Posts.Title: Everything going wrong so many things to worry about.

Posts.Content: Hi Snowys mum, sending lots of hugs good luck tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Spine MRI tomorrow can't eat, sleep, concentrate.

Posts.Content: Hi Kathryn. The operation is ok I was terrified of having the anneasthetic but honestly alll the staff were wonderful, next thing I woke up in recovery had a little discomfort had a drain in that was ok bit of a pain carrying it round though.  I could have gone home that night but wanted to stay overnight because I was tired went home next day, nurses came to check the drain just had it in for about 5 day’s, you will be ok try not to worry to much, I just wanted the lump and nodes out as quickly as possible. Good luck let us know how you get on. Sending hugs.
Posts.Title: Lymph node recurrence after axillary clearance

Posts.Content: Hi, well done for getting so much money for McMillan it all help', good luck with Rad's I have had mine it was a doddle, cream twice a day, make sure you eat properly, and 2ltrs of water on top of other drinks help' with the tiredness.
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda 865.     I had 24 nodes removed I had cancer in I of them so surgeon said to be on the safe side take them all out, had WLE as well, numbness underneath my arm and armpit but doesn’t really bother me I am used to it , I had the Lumpectomy last June so not to bad really had the all clear Mammogram this year.
Posts.Title: Lymph node recurrence after axillary clearance

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda 865.     I had 24 nodes removed I had cancer in I of them so surgeon said to be on the safe side take them all out, had WLE as well, numbness underneath my arm and armpit but doesn’t really bother me I am used to it , I had the Lumpectomy last June so not to bad really had the all clear Mammogram this year.
Posts.Title: Lymph node recurrence after axillary clearance

Posts.Content: Hi Kathryn. The operation is ok I was terrified of having the anneasthetic but honestly alll the staff were wonderful, next thing I woke up in recovery had a little discomfort had a drain in that was ok bit of a pain carrying it round though.  I could have gone home that night but wanted to stay overnight because I was tired went home next day, nurses came to check the drain just had it in for about 5 day’s, you will be ok try not to worry to much, I just wanted the lump and nodes out as quickly as possible. Good luck let us know how you get on. Sending hugs.
Posts.Title: Lymph node recurrence after axillary clearance

Posts.Content: Hi welcome you will get a lot of advice on her about your treatment, I have had WLE and Radiotheraphy 15 sessions and I am on Letrozol , haven't had any real problems I have alway's been quite positive throughout this journey, I think the worse part is when your told you have it, then you have to get on with it and try to get on with life, Breast Cancer is very treatable now much better than it was years ago, good luck with your operation If you need any advice just come onto the forum.
Posts.Title: Recently been diagnosed, looking for support through my journey.

Posts.Content: Hi.    I have been on Letrozol for two years and my hair has thinned a lot, are there any products that will improve the texture and growth.
Posts.Title: Hair thinning with Letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi Henty.   So sorry your feelin awful I was the same two years ago, had Lumpectomy and node clearance it’s a terrible time at the beginning but you will get through it I just wanted it out as soon as possible, we will all be thinking of you on here as many of us have been through it and come out the other side, Good Luck to you let us know how you get on.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Knighty, sorry to hear about your Mum, I had Lobular Cancer April 2017, and my daughter 2015 a different one to mine DCIS. It has been difficult as my daughter was 48 when diagnosed and I was 72, we are ok now as we have a wonderful family and have helped each other through this nightmare and I am sure you and your Mum will get through it too. Sending hugs.
Posts.Title: Mums breast cancer diagnosis

Posts.Content: Good luck with your Radiotheraphy you will be ok, it soon goes over drink plenty of water and eat well fruit and veg, and cream twice a day, we will be here for you on the forum if you need any advice. Hugs
Posts.Title: My Treatment Plan

Posts.Content: Hi Janet. Lucky you going to see Ed Sheeran he is great, so sorry you are struggling with your hormone tablets, I am on Treva brand Letrozol a haven’t really had any side effects I take it at night 6Oclock , andrink plenty of water hope this helps, enjoy the show.
Posts.Title: Tired of fighting for the least evil tablets

Posts.Content: Hi Mirabo, so glad your nearly finished with Rads, the last day is great you get to ring the bell and everyone claps, I had no problem with rads in fact I enjoyed going to the hostpital and having my coffee chatting to people because we usually see them every day, so glad you think the water helped, I am 2 weeks on from rads don't put cream on anymore , my right boob is slightly smaller but only a little bit where they took some tissue away , I do get tired sometimes but can deal with that.
Posts.Title: My Treatment Plan

Posts.Content: Hi Tia , I had node clearance 24 taken out 1 had cancer in it, I asked the surgeon why take them all out? he said it was just to be on the safe side, so trusted him and had it done a bit sore after but not to bad really, glad there all out.
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi Louise I had WLE. And kept pants on didn’t wear a bra, you will be ok it will be over before you know it.Good luck and hugs.
Posts.Title: Under wear when having surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Moomc, Oh my god Aintree are wonderful aren’t they, Mr Laffi was my Surgeon a lovely man, I have nothing but praise for the Doctor’s and Nurses they were so good to me.  Do you live in Aintree I live in Formby.
Posts.Title: Letrozole Brands and side effects

Posts.Content: So lovely so true thank you.
Posts.Title: The BC Paradox and a Thank you

Posts.Content: Hi, I had Lumpectomy in June ful node clearance, operation is ok no problems I was a little nervous but it was over in no time, I would say it took about a month to recover so not to bad my husband did most of the housework, now 2 month's on I am ok, just finishing Rads my last one on Thursday sailed through them no problem a little tired, if your having Rads drink 2Ltrs of water a day it help's with the tiredness and do your arm exercises every day, try not to do to much don't forget you have had an operation so take it easy.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy questions...

Posts.Content: Hi, I have been on Letrozol for 10 month’s the TEVA brand, haven’t really had many side effect’s only a bit achey at times, but I am 72 a lot older than the ladies on here, Intake my tablet at 6 o’clock every night, hair has gone a bit thinner . This drug they told me is to stop the cancer returning so will carry on taking it if that’s the case don’t want it to come back, I know you ladies have had terrible side effect’s with Letrozol but try to persevere with it or change the brand there are quite a few differen’t brand’s out there. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Letrozole Brands and side effects

Posts.Content: Hi I am so sorry you are having a bad time, it’s horrible at first isn’t it I was diagnosed in April and had WLE Lumpectomy and node clearance, had 15 Rads, as time goes by and you get your treatment plan it will get a little easier, the treatment now is a lot better and at least you have found it and it’s small, good luck and before you know it the operation will be over, when you have Radiotheraphy drink plenty of water it does help.
Posts.Title: Hi I've just been diagnosed with dcis I'm 31 and am awaiting an op...

Posts.Content: Hi.   I have had it due my third one in November no side effects except the first treatment I was aching the next day, don’t worry it’s ok and it is worth having they say it helps with recurrence.
Posts.Title: Zoledronic acid ( Bisphosphonate )

Posts.Content: Hi onwards and upwards now well done, that cake sound's gorgeous.
Posts.Title: WLE and SNB, check!

Posts.Content: Hi Trapin1. I had treatment for breast cancer 2 years ago , I take Letrozol and Sertraline for anxiety.
Posts.Title: Taking anti-depressants or St John’s Wort with letrozole

Posts.Content: Great news Snuggles so pleased for you still has been  terrible worry for you and your family.
Posts.Title: At last a result

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, great thread need something to keep me going, can’t walk far at the moment as I have a foot problem, going to the clinic on the 5th Feb so hopefully they will sort it out. Looking forward to walking determined to do it, will keep you all updated.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi lovely Ladies, haven’t been out today got foot problem , did some jobs around the house hubby helped me clean the oven horrible job, changed the bed did some washing, glad to see your all walking keep it up ladies.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi ladies haven’t been on for a while, had my foot problem sorted I have had two corn’s in between my toes, they have been quite painful, anyway they are ok now, so walked all round our village and then walked home, it took half an hour so probably did an hour today, going to do a bit each day.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hiya you are not silly at all, we know how you are feeling we have all been through it on here and just come on here for a bit of advice it certainly helped me a lot when I was diagnosed, your callback will probably be a calcification or perhaps they didn't get a good picture that happened to me, good luck let us know how you get on.
Posts.Title: Mammogram recall

Posts.Content: Hi, I had very little pain Doctor gave me codiene 30 MG, they seemed to knock me out, underarm was numb and still is, but not as bad, I was only in overnight had drains in for five day’s, just got fed up carrying it round, don’t worry you will be ok , make sure you do your excercises every day.
Posts.Title: Any Her2+ grade 3 IDC ( having a bad day today )

Posts.Content: Thinking about you today, try not to be to dispondent I know it’s hard but we have to get on with our lives for the sake of our family, I have been positive to but do have down day’s, I didn’t have chemo just WLE 1 node affected so had full clearance, surgeon said he took 24 Out, had Radiotheraphy it was ok no burns but tired.Good luck. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Any Her2+ grade 3 IDC ( having a bad day today )

Posts.Content: Hi welcome to the forum we are all in this together and we help each other a lot, when we are down there is alway's someone to make us feel a bit better.
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Just thought I would let you all know got my letter today saying mammogram all clear I am so pleased
Posts.Title: Clea

Posts.Content: Thinking about you yellowdafodil, keep going love your a star.xx
Posts.Title: 2nd lot of chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Nicole I didn’t cry but my husband and daughter did they were with me and I was told I had cancer on the same day. The shock of it made me go frozen couldn’t believe it was happening to me, it’s horrible hearing that news worst time of my life, I have been positive through it for the sake of my family had my ops and Radiotheraphy last June I just thought I am going to beat this I just get on with life.Good Luck.
Posts.Title: Someone to talk to

Posts.Content: Brilliant new’s.xx
Posts.Title: Normal MRI scan

Posts.Content: I hate that advert shave the brave I didn’t have chemo but I find this very upsetting for all Cancer patients, there was another advert can’t remember which one it was but I just cried it certainly didn’t make me feel any better.  We have all been through enough with this horrible disease and we don’t want to see these things. My granddaughters and family have recently walked round Snowden and done a half marathon for cancer research they raised £1.000 I was so proud of them.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi , yes I still get very tired, was doing housework this morning and had to stop for a bit to have a rest, felt so exhausted, had my radio in September really thought it would be gone by now. The consultant told me it last’s for a couple of month’s, he said walking is the best thing for it, so will have to get my walking boot’s but quite honesty I am so fatigued don’t think I can do it at the moment, make sure you have some rest during the day.
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi, I have this treatment, having second one in May, it’s nothing to worry about really just had one day aching, they told me it keeps the Cancer out of the bones, so didn’t hesitate just took their advice.
Posts.Title: Anyone refused to take bisphosphonates?

Posts.Content: Hi it’s awful at the beginning isn’t you won’t know what to do with yourself and you will be scared, the ladies on here including me have been through that terrible time, but believe me it will get easier in time when you get your treatment plan, I was diagnosed in April found the lump myself , had W.L.E. And one node was involved , 15 treatment’s of Radiotheraphy don’t be scared it’s ok.Now eight months later I am ok and have just been signed off from the hostpital the Surgeon and all staff were wonderful to me and I am so grateful for that, try not to worry to much at least they have found it and it can be dealt with, the treatment is very good now so Good luck for Friday, let us know how you get on. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Waiting for my breast biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hi, I also knit I am in our local Women’s institute and we have done a lot of knitting for charities, we knitted quite a few twiddle muffs for dementia patients, and prem hats blanket’s , I too find it relaxing I am doing a bit of embiodery at the moment haven’t done it for years , I find it takes my mind off thing’s and I like the peace.
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi don't think it would be anything sinister so soon after Lumpectomy, but do get it checked out just to be sure.
Posts.Title: Found another lump!

Posts.Content: Hi all, oh my goodness what a clever lot you are, went to John Lewis and bought two small cross stitch , one of a dog, the other with flower’s on it, year’s ago we used to trace it onto the material, but the one’s I have got you have to count the square’s, my eyesight isn’t as good as it was but will have a go.
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Roche, drink plenty of water and eat well and cream up 3times a day, I did this and didn’t have any side effects except tiredness toward’s the end of treatment. Good luck sending hugs.xx
Posts.Title: First session of Radiotherapy today

Posts.Content: Hi all, my lump was 4.5.cm. Couldn’t wait to have it out.
Posts.Title: How big is your lump?

Posts.Content: Good luck Ange hope all goes well. Love and hugs.
Posts.Title: Big op tomorrow!

Posts.Content: Hi I had WLE in June and have had the odd electric shock under my arm and a few other niggles, it’s just the nerves, every time I got a pain I was worried, but don’t worry so much now, your’s is early day’s it takes time to heal.
Posts.Title: Pain after wide local excision

Posts.Content: ‘Hi all going through Radiotheraphy.   Cream I used what the hostpital gave me it was called Aqua cream didn't use anything else, drink plenty of water and eat something before you go, boob will look like it’s sunburnt . The only bug bare is going every day but I quite enjoyed going felt safe, don’t worry about it’ll be ok the days go very quickly and in the end you get to ring the bell. Good luck to you all going through it.
Posts.Title: **JUNE BREAST CANCER RADIOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi. Yes I was offered chemo by my surgeon , my oncologist said I didn’t need it as the stats were low so I took my oncologists advice and opted out of Chemo mainly because of my age I had Lumpectomy full node clearance 1 node was affected I was 72 then, I presume you are younger than me, it is your decision whether you have it or not , my Cancer was grade2 Lobular HER2 negative so I take Letrozol for 5 years and also have Zoledronic acid treatment at the hostpital twice a year for 3 years it’s supposed to help the bones. Good luck
Posts.Title: to choose chemo or not ??

Posts.Content: Hi TIY.    Welcome to the forum just wanted you to know we will be thinking of you, most of the ladies on here have been through the trauma of this herendous desease but we have come through it all , it’s not easy at the beginning but you will get a lot of support on here.Good Luck Sending hugs.
Posts.Title: New Here

Posts.Content: So sorry it's horrible at first but you will get better, there are a lot of ladies on the forum who have been on this journey, but we are all here for you, if you need any help at all just get on here, the forum has been a godsend to me , breast cancer is very treatable now. Good Luck
Posts.Title: Breast cancer at 50

Posts.Content: Hi please go to your GP and get it sorted.Sending hugs.
Posts.Title: Paranoid.

Posts.Content: Hi Scarlettem, your mind will be all over the place at the moment I really feel for you, I will never forget that day when I was diagnosed, I was in complete shock and thought the doctor was talking to somebody else and I didn’t cry and never have, the thing that kept me going was thinking I was lucky to have found the lump early, and my family and some friends have been very good, try to think positive I know it’s very hard at first but as time goes on all will become clearer when you get your treatment plan, good luck come on the forum if you need to talk.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today with Breast Cancer at 31

Posts.Content: Hi 966504.   I was diagnosed with Lobular cancer grade 2 . 44mm tumour. 1 lymph node with cancer. Lumpectomy and node clearance   .My Surgeon did suggest I have chemo but I refused it mainly because of my age if Ihad been younger I probably would have had it, when I saw my oncologist she said I didn’t need it as  predict score was 3%. I was 72 at that time it’s coming up to 2 years now I know I have made the right decision.
Posts.Title: Advice on chemo - my mum has just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi, I had Radiotheraphy in September 15 of them with booster’s, I was ok all the way through them really, Breast changed colour to a sunburnt look wasn’t really sore, I was tired having to go to the hostpital every day, just a bit of advice drink lot’s of water about 2 ltrs a day, I swear it helped me. Good luck.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Horrible person, think I would have punched her in the face.
Posts.Title: Just need a rant

Posts.Content: Hi I have had 3 of Zoledronic treatments no side effect’s at all.
Posts.Title: Starting Zolendronate

Posts.Content: Hi, I had surgery in July followed by Radiotheraphy, I told close family member's first, the put on Face book thought it would be better that way, we live in a close little village where everybody know's everyone else, my husband is heartbroken but he kept telling most people in the village about my illness, so every time I went shopping load's of people stopped me, some were ok but other's had that look of doom, I was annoyed with hubby I asked him why he did this, is it some sort of comfort to you to tell people and he said yes, he has been wonderful though can't fault him really, anyway had my treatment now just got to have Acid Zoldronic in November, I am quite positive but Cancer is alway's at the back of our mind's isn't it , we can't do anything about that, me and hubby watch something funny on television and have a good laugh that's the best medicine, so all stay strong and positive keep going warriors.
Posts.Title: How to tell friends?

Posts.Content: Hi, I personally wouldn't use those pad's, I had 15 rad's and just used their cream nothing else, it's 2 weeks since finishing treatment I have a slight rash but just keep putting the cream on, you are drinking lot's of water that's good because it help's with the fatigue , also try to eat nourishing foods like protein, veg, fruit .Good Luck.
Posts.Title: Ice and RT?

Posts.Content: Welcome Lou1234. Sending lots of hugs and good luck.
Posts.Title: Hello, I’m new to this and would love a friendly hello

Posts.Content: So happy for you.
Posts.Title: Phew!

Posts.Content: Hi, yes I was petrified as well I had Lumpectomy and node clearance, but all the staff at the hostpital were brilliant, went in for the op, then woke up in recovery, home the next day then had to go back a week later for cavity shave, wasn’t frightened at all the second time , you will be ok just get it over and done.Good luck.
Posts.Title: Feeling terrified

Posts.Content: Hi I had full node clearance in July it was painfull at the begining, after a few weeks it was ok; still have numbness under arm and underside of arm, you will probably always have numbness there as I do after 4 months, look after yourself all will be ok soon.
Posts.Title: Recovery after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi just posted this on my Facebook page it’s great hope some people watch it.
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hi Sunflower, I had Lumpectomy last June I wasn’t in much pain really, I did have sensitivity near the scar which is normal and numbness on the underside of my arm , it does get better eventually although the numbness does stay in the long run but not as bad, the nerves are affected with this operation so don’t worry too much it’s early day’s for you, do your excercises daily try to take it easy. Good Luck.x
Posts.Title: Hello and skin sensitivity post lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Thank you.
Posts.Title: Bones

Posts.Content: Has anybody had this done Zoledronic Acid (Zoledronate) in the treatment for early breast cancer, have to go every 6 months for 3 years on a intravenous drip for 15 minutes each treatment, apparently it helps the bones in older ladies past menopause but it does have side effects like all treatment, the Oncologist wants me to have it .
Posts.Title: Bones

Posts.Content: Well done and Good Luck.
Posts.Title: Ringing the radiotherapy bell

Posts.Content: Hi I remember you on the forum so glad it’s all over now and that your enjoying life again, I was diagnosed in April this year and finished treatment in September, good luck to you, there is light at the end of the tunnel although we don’t think that at the beginning. Good Luck to you.
Posts.Title: Popping in to say hello

Posts.Content: First year mammogram all clear so pleased.
Posts.Title: Good new’s

Posts.Content: Hi Phaedra. The mammogram was ok no pain at all, the letter came today I was so relieved now we can book a holiday, you were probably diagnosed about the same time as me, you will be ok it’s the waiting that’s the worse part, my letter took two weeks to arrive. Good luck sending hugs.
Posts.Title: Good new’s

Posts.Content: Thank you all you lovely ladies, just having a double Gin and tonic. Whooooooo.
Posts.Title: Good new’s

Posts.Content: Hi all this Letrozol thing is bugging me can’t understand why you poor ladies have bad side effects, I’ve been on it for 5 months now with no problems, the tablets I am on are from Glenmark, Middlesex. U.K. they are dark yellow and marked with 5 on one side and H on the other, is anybody on these.
Posts.Title: Letrozole issues AGAIN! Need advice

Posts.Content: Oh no that’s awful news but you can do it again because we have no choice there will be more treatment and it’s been diagnosed early, I know you will be feeling terrible now but we will all be thinking about you, mine was 2 years ago and I am due second Mammo soon.Good Luck Sending hugs.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time
